Deleting Labels

In StarTeam, you can completely remove a view or revision label from a view, although you can create a new label with the same name later, if desired.

When you delete a label, it is no longer visible in any list of labels, nor is it attached to any folders or items. The only exception is when you roll back the view to a date and time when the label existed.

If a label is frozen, you must unfreeze it before you can delete it. See Freezing or Unfreezing Labels for more information.

To delete a label:

  1. On the View or context menu, select Labels. This action displays the Labels dialog.

  2. If the label to be deleted is a view label, select the View tab. If the label to be deleted is a revision label, select the Revision tab. These tabs list existing labels in reverse chronological order, based on the time that they were created.

  3. Select the label.

  4. Click Delete. This action removes the label from the view.
